issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The directory to store buckets (in QA
/disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/bukkits/) has permissions 755 when in HA
mode. All files inside are also world-readable. That means that any user
having an account on that machine will be able to access (read) buckets.

  
After debugging with Neil, the problem seems to be related to use of drbd
which mounts to this directory in HA mode.
fields.summary: in HA mode permissions on bukkits directory are too open

comments.body:
Originally posted on 2012-01-18 01:29:30 by rusvika

Tue Jan 17 17:29:29 2012: Request 5707 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Ticket created by vika.felmetsger
       Queue: Engineering Bugs
     Subject: in HA mode permissions on bukkits directory are too open
       Owner: Nobody
  Requestors: Vika.Felmetsger@eucalyptus.com
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=5707 >


The directory to store buckets (in QA
/disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/bukkits/) has permissions 755 when in HA
mode. All files inside are also world-readable. That means that any user having
an account on that machine will be able to access (read) buckets.

After debugging with Neil, the problem seems to be related to use of drbd which
mounts to this directory in HA mode.

Originally posted on 2012-01-18 18:35:47 by tjcramer

Wed Jan 18 10:35:47 2012: Request 5707 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Given to neil by tim.cramer
       Queue: Engineering Bugs
     Subject: in HA mode permissions on bukkits directory are too open
       Owner: neil
  Requestors: Vika.Felmetsger@eucalyptus.com
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=5707 >


This transaction appears to have no content

Originally posted on 2012-01-18 19:10:25 by admin
https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=5707 This is a comment.
It is not sent to the Requestor(s): In the non-HA case this also applies to
all the bukkit directories. Should be addressed after 3.0

Originally posted on 2012-01-18 19:10:25 by tjcramer
In the non-HA case this also applies to all the bukkit directories.  Should be
addressed after 3.0

Originally posted on 2012-01-18 20:19:17 by rusvika
I am not sure why it applies to non-HA case. As far as I know (and see in QA),
bukkits dir in non-HA case has permissions:

  
drwx------ 7 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4.0K 2012-01-16 09:50 bukkits

  
which means that noone other than root and user eucalyptus should be able to
access its contents.

  
On Wed Jan 18 11:10:25 2012, tim.cramer wrote:

> In the non-HA case this also applies to all the bukkit directories.

> Should be

> addressed after 3.0

Originally posted on 2012-01-18 20:19:17 by admin
https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=5707 This is a comment.
It is not sent to the Requestor(s): I am not sure why it applies to non-HA
case. As far as I know (and see in QA), bukkits dir in non-HA case has
permissions: drwx------ 7 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4.0K 2012-01-16 09:50 bukkits
which means that noone other than root and user eucalyptus should be able to
access its contents. On Wed Jan 18 11:10:25 2012, tim.cramer wrote: > In the
non-HA case this also applies to all the bukkit directories. > Should be >
addressed after 3.0

Originally posted on 2012-01-18 20:42:25
So in the HA and non-HA case, if the base dir perms are correctly set (i.e.
700), no other user should be able to access buckets.

  
With the one line patch that I suggested, HA and non HA will work the same and
users will not be able to access buckets.

  
For instance,

  
[root@eucahost-51-33 ~]# cat /proc/mounts

rootfs / rootfs rw 0 0

/dev/root / ext3 rw,data=ordered 0 0

/dev /dev tmpfs rw 0 0

/proc /proc proc rw 0 0

/sys /sys sysfs rw 0 0

none /selinux selinuxfs rw 0 0

/proc/bus/usb /proc/bus/usb usbfs rw 0 0

devpts /dev/pts devpts rw 0 0

tmpfs /dev/shm tmpfs rw 0 0

none /proc/sys/fs/binfmt_misc binfmt_misc rw 0 0

sunrpc /var/lib/nfs/rpc_pipefs rpc_pipefs rw 0 0

/etc/auto.misc /misc autofs
rw,fd=7,pgrp=2683,timeout=300,minproto=5,maxproto=5,indirect 0 0

-hosts /net autofs rw,fd=13,pgrp=2683,timeout=300,minproto=5,maxproto=5,indirect 0 0  
none /var/lib/xenstored tmpfs rw 0 0

/dev/sda3 /disk1/storage ext3 rw,data=ordered 0 0

/dev/drbd1 /disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/bukkits ext4
rw,barrier=1,data=ordered 0 0

  
Ooh, let's look at bukkits perms

  
[root@eucahost-51-33 ~]# ls -l /disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/

total 12

drwx------ 4 eucalyptus root 4096 Jan 18 12:36 bukkits

drwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 Jan 18 11:03 vmware

  
Yay.

  
But what about inside bukkits?

  
[root@eucahost-51-33 ~]# ls -l /disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/bukkits/

total 24

drwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 Jan 18 12:37 fwewewffew

drwx------ 2 root root 16384 Jan 18 11:33 lost+found

  
Oh nos!

  
Let's try to be the bad guy.

  
[root@eucahost-51-33 ~]# su foobar

  
Haha I am "foobar" not "root" or "eucalyptus" Do I has your bukkits?

  
[foobar@eucahost-51-33 root]$ ls
/disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/bukkits/fwewewffew

ls: /disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/bukkits/fwewewffew: Permission denied

  
Cannot have your bukkits!

  
Which is good.

  
Dan = 0 . Vika = 1.

Originally posted on 2012-01-18 20:42:26

<URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=5707 >

So in the HA and non-HA case, if the base dir perms are correctly set (i.e.
700), no other user should be able to access buckets.

With the one line patch that I suggested, HA and non HA will work the same and
users will not be able to access buckets.

For instance,

[root@eucahost-51-33 ~]# cat /proc/mounts
rootfs / rootfs rw 0 0
/dev/root / ext3 rw,data=ordered 0 0

-hosts /net autofs
rw,fd=13,pgrp=2683,timeout=300,minproto=5,maxproto=5,indirect 0 0
none /var/lib/xenstored tmpfs rw 0 0
/dev/sda3 /disk1/storage ext3 rw,data=ordered 0 0
/dev/drbd1 /disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/bukkits ext4
rw,barrier=1,data=ordered 0 0

Ooh, let's look at bukkits perms

total 12
drwx------ 4 eucalyptus root 4096 Jan 18 12:36 bukkits

Yay.

But what about inside bukkits?

[root@eucahost-51-33 ~]# ls -l /disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/bukkits/
total 24
drwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 Jan 18 12:37 fwewewffew
drwx------ 2 root root 16384 Jan 18 11:33 lost+found

Oh nos!

Let's try to be the bad guy.

[root@eucahost-51-33 ~]# su foobar

Haha I am "foobar" not "root" or "eucalyptus" Do I has your bukkits?

[foobar@eucahost-51-33 root]$ ls
/disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/bukkits/fwewewffew
ls: /disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/bukkits/fwewewffew: Permission denied

Cannot have your bukkits!

Which is good.

Dan = 0 . Vika = 1.

or "eucalyptus" Do I has your bukkits? [foobar@eucahost-51-33 root]$ ls

Originally posted on 2012-01-18 21:10:14
Fix is here:

  
bzr merge -c neil@eucalyptus.com-20120118204931-wnr8r8tickrwv67e
sftp://castillian/home/repositories/eucalyptus/eee_clc_dev/

  
Waiting Vee Pee approval.
